::: {.column width="50%"}
The NEXUS (**N**etwork of **EX**posomics in the **U**nited **S**tates) is a Center for Exposome Research Coordination (CERC).

The center aims to serve the broad biomedical research community by orchestrating the advancement and promotion of exposome research.

The center is supported by the National Institutes of Health under grant number [**U24ES036819**](https://reporter.nih.gov/project-details/10993456 "NIH Reporter"). 

Learn more [about the center and the exposome here](about.html), and catch up with the [latest news from the center here](news.html).

:::
:::

## Support

We are proud to have funding support from the following NIH institutes and Office:

-   National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences ([NIEHS](https://www.niehs.nih.gov/))
-   National Institute on Aging ([NIA](https://www.nia.nih.gov/))
-   National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke ([NINDS](https://www.ninds.nih.gov/))
-   National Cancer Institute ([NCI](https://www.cancer.gov/))
-   National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases ([NIAMS](https://www.niams.nih.gov/))
-   Office of Research on Women's Health ([ORWH](https://orwh.od.nih.gov))

More information can be found on [NIH RePORTER](https://reporter.nih.gov/project-details/10993456).
